definition: to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: I have been granted a leave of to learn the advanced and in .
sentences.chinese: 我被准予公假前去学习先进的和。

sentences.english: Associated persons of securities firms that have been registered and approved by this Corporation.
sentences.chinese: 二经本公司登记准予进入市场之证券商业务人员。

sentences.english: She was the only one granted bail.
sentences.chinese: 她是惟一一个准予保释的嫌疑人。

sentences.english: Divorce shall be granted if mediation fails because mutual affection no long exists.
sentences.chinese: 如感情确已破裂，调解无效，应准予离婚。

sentences.english: Amazingly he was granted parole because sufficient doubt remained about his innocence.
sentences.chinese: 戏剧性的是他被准予假释，因为许多人相信他的清白。

sentences.english: On the ninth I signed legislation granting the President a line-item veto.
sentences.chinese: 9日，我签署法令，准予美国总统拥有单项否决权。

sentences.english: A lien against the property is granted to secure an obligation
sentences.chinese: 准予对财产拥有留置权以保证义务之履行。

sentences.english: His talk was red-penciled before it got clearance.
sentences.chinese: 他的谈话经过删改后才准予发表。

sentences.english: I HAs be granted a leave of to absorb the advanced or in .
sentences.chinese: 我被准予公假前去温习先进的和。

sentences.english: Article 31 Divorce shall be granted if husband and wife both desire it.
sentences.chinese: 第三十一条男女双方志愿离婚的，准予离婚。

definition: according to provisions/as stipulated in the rules
to state explicitly in writing/to specify/to stipulate
to audit and determine/to check and ratify/to appraise and decide/determination/on a deemed basis (taxation)/to deem
to regard the same as/to regard as being the same as
to report, requesting approval/written request for instructions
(to do sth) separately/as a separate action
judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
to expire/to run out/to come to an end
